page.title: 15Bradley and its Library
page.content: In the library they receive about 200 people per day. There are 500 child members and 860 adults. On average they have around 17000 books 12000 for adults and the rest for children. More staff need to be appointed and people need to use the library more often. There are many vandals in the area and as a result the library is to move to Daisy Bank. The library has been on its present site for twenty years. Bradley has enough Primary schools but there should be a Secondary School closer than Hall Green. The area is pleasant but it is a shame that it is so often illtreated. The Industrial waste land has been grassed over and there are plans to build houses on it. At the moment the land is used for recreation purposes. The Southern part of Bradley has plenty of shops but no petrol station.
